text: The Hyundai Equus was a large luxury car made by Hyundai from 1999 to 2016. == First generation (LZ/YJ; 1999) == The first generation of the Hyundai Equus was introduced in 1999. It was built with the help of Mitsubishi Motors The first generation came with 3.0 3.3 3.5 and 3.8 V6 liter and also 4.5 liter V8 petrol engines with a 5-speed automatic transmission the Equus also had a limousine version The car and the limousine were mainly sold in South Korea it was made until 2009. == Second generation (VI; 2009) == The second generation of the Hyundai Equus was launched in 2009 Unlike the first model, this generation featured a rear-wheel drive layout, The car was built on a new platform and was available with 3.8 liter V6 and 4.6 and 5.0 liter V8 engines. It had a 6-speed and 8-speed automatic transmissions. The Equus was offered in a sedan and limousine version, with the limousine being much longer and designed for VIPs and government use. == Markets == The Hyundai Equus was initially sold only in South Korea and the second generation was sold in South America Central America United States Canada Russia China and South Korea, in Middle East, it was sold as the Hyundai Centennial. == Discontinuation == On November 4, 2015, Hyundai said it would move the Genesis model to its new luxury brand, Genesis Motor. The car that replaced the Hyundai Equus in 2016 was renamed the Genesis G90 (called the EQ900 in South Korea until 2018). == References == Equus Category:Sedans Category:1990s automobiles Category:2000s automobiles Category:2010s automobiles
